column4: Question: Is there a known problem with the Fglrx Driver and 9.04? I just fresh installed ubuntu, installed fglr & the control center, and my computer couldn't even boot up. I had to boot into root safe mode, and purge the driver. Any ideas?
I have no ideas... but you are not the first one. Some try to use fglrx with not supported cards, others have fglrx problems with supported cards.
I forget my card model, but its the mac pro ati, and i was using fglrx on 8.10 with no issues. I'll try to dig somethin up, thanks minimec & daftykins
Is there a secondary driver that i can use instead of fglrx? Or is that the default i already have installed?
the opensource driver is installed by default. there is another radeonhd, bur it's early stage.
K thanks
http://support.amd.com/us/gpudownload/linux/legacy/Pages/radeon_linux.aspx?type=2.7&product=2.7.4.3.3.3.1&lang=English For these card there is no fglrx driver in jaunty
Did this just take place in jaunty?
Jaunty uses xorg 1.6 There is no driver for xorg 1.6 for the cards on the upper link.
Any idea how to figure out what card i have? Eg, is there somethin in jaunty that can fix it?
Open a terminal and type 'lspci |grep VGA'
Bah, yea i have the X1900 XT
So this is permanent? There will be no fglrx? Or is it just a delay, in releasing it?
So you can use the opensource driver (you are probably using it right now), or switch back to intrepid.
bummer, k thanks
I think i just need to buy a new graphics card :D
Step back to intrepid, if you have problems and wait some month. The driver will improve, because ATI gave the source to the community.
Ooo
Well if i dont have issues, im fine. As long as it works well with my multiple monitor setup. Thats the main priority.
Good luck. I have a two screen system with a nvidia 7600gt. Really painless... ;)
Well it didnt work in intrepid, i had to use fglrx. So far its not working, but it wants me to restart the desktop, so we'll see once i do
